channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SHARP Challenge 2023: Solving CAD History and pArameters Recovery from Point clouds and 3D scans. Overview, Datasets, Metrics, and Baselines
item.description: In this paper, we define the proposed SHARP 2023 tracks, describe the provided datasets, and propose a set of baseline methods along with suitable evaluation metrics to assess the performance of the track solutions.

item.title: AGS: An Dataset and Taxonomy for Domestic Scene Sound Event Recognition
item.description: In particular, there is no public common data set for the research field of sound event recognition for the data set of the indoor environmental sound scene.

item.title: Likelihood-based inference and forecasting for trawl processes: a stochastic optimization approach
item.description: In this paper, we develop the first likelihood-based methodology for the inference of real-valued trawl processes and introduce novel deterministic and probabilistic forecasting methods.

item.title: Nemo: First Glimpse of a New Rule Engine
item.description: This system demonstration presents Nemo, a new logic programming engine with a focus on reliability and performance.

item.title: Text-to-OverpassQL: A Natural Language Interface for Complex Geodata Querying of OpenStreetMap
item.description: We present Text-to-OverpassQL, a task designed to facilitate a natural language interface for querying geodata from OpenStreetMap (OSM).

item.title: MMVP: Motion-Matrix-based Video Prediction
item.description: A central challenge of video prediction lies where the system has to reason the objects' future motions from image frames while simultaneously maintaining the consistency of their appearances across frames.

item.title: Peering Through Preferences: Unraveling Feedback Acquisition for Aligning Large Language Models
item.description: In particular, we find that LLMs that leverage rankings data for alignment (say model X) are preferred over those that leverage ratings data (say model Y), with a rank-based evaluation protocol (is X/Y's response better than reference response?)

item.title: CircleFormer: Circular Nuclei Detection in Whole Slide Images with Circle Queries and Attention
item.description: Inspired by the recent anchor free CNN-based circular object detection method (CircleNet) for ball-shape glomeruli detection in renal pathology, in this paper, we present CircleFormer, a Transformer-based circular medical object detection with dynamic anchor circles.

item.title: Towards Earlier Detection of Oral Diseases On Smartphones Using Oral and Dental RGB Images
item.description: Oral diseases such as periodontal (gum) diseases and dental caries (cavities) affect billions of people across the world today.

item.title: Latency-aware Unified Dynamic Networks for Efficient Image Recognition
item.description: Dynamic computation has emerged as a promising avenue to enhance the inference efficiency of deep networks.

item.title: Interpretability-guided Data Augmentation for Robust Segmentation in Multi-centre Colonoscopy Data
item.description: Multi-centre colonoscopy images from various medical centres exhibit distinct complicating factors and overlays that impact the image content, contingent on the specific acquisition centre.

item.title: SAM-Med2D
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce SAM-Med2D, the most comprehensive studies on applying SAM to medical 2D images.

item.title: GREC: Generalized Referring Expression Comprehension
item.description: This dataset encompasses a range of expressions: those referring to multiple targets, expressions with no specific target, and the single-target expressions.

item.title: Response: Emergent analogical reasoning in large language models
item.description: In their recent Nature Human Behaviour paper, "Emergent analogical reasoning in large language models," (Webb, Holyoak, and Lu, 2023) the authors argue that "large language models such as GPT-3 have acquired an emergent ability to find zero-shot solutions to a broad range of analogy problems."

item.title: Speech Wikimedia: A 77 Language Multilingual Speech Dataset
item.description: The Speech Wikimedia Dataset is a publicly available compilation of audio with transcriptions extracted from Wikimedia Commons.

item.title: Deontic Paradoxes in ASP with Weak Constraints
item.description: The rise of powerful AI technology for a range of applications that are sensitive to legal, social, and ethical norms demands decision-making support in presence of norms and regulations.

item.title: Iterative Reward Shaping using Human Feedback for Correcting Reward Misspecification
item.description: Our approach allows the user to provide trajectory-level feedback on agent's behavior during training, which can be integrated as a reward shaping signal in the following training iteration.

item.title: Explanations for Answer Set Programming
item.description: Different from xASP, the new system, xASP2, supports different clingo constructs like the choice rules, the constraints, and the aggregates such as #sum, #min.

item.title: Improving Few-shot Image Generation by Structural Discrimination and Textural Modulation
item.description: Furthermore, the frequency awareness of the model is reinforced by encouraging the model to distinguish frequency signals.

item.title: Low-light image enhancement based on sharpening-smoothing image filter
item.description: Finally, inverse HSV transform is applied to the enhanced V component and H, S components to obtain the enhanced image.

item.title: SharpSAT-TD in Model Counting Competitions 2021-2023
item.description: We describe SharpSAT-TD, our submission to the unweighted and weighted tracks of the Model Counting Competition in 2021-2023, which has won in total $6$ first places in different tracks of the competition.

item.title: LLaSM: Large Language and Speech Model
item.description: In this work, we propose Large Language and Speech Model (LLaSM).

item.title: Improving Underwater Visual Tracking With a Large Scale Dataset and Image Enhancement
item.description: The method has resulted in a significant performance improvement, of up to 5. 0% AUC, of state-of-the-art (SOTA) visual trackers.

item.title: Towards One-Shot Learning for Text Classification using Inductive Logic Programming
item.description: With the ever-increasing potential of AI to perform personalised tasks, it is becoming essential to develop new machine learning techniques which are data-efficient and do not require hundreds or thousands of training data.

item.title: Benchmarking Multilabel Topic Classification in the Kyrgyz Language
item.description: Kyrgyz is a very underrepresented language in terms of modern natural language processing resources.

item.title: Exploring Deep Learning for Full-disk Solar Flare Prediction with Empirical Insights from Guided Grad-CAM Explanations
item.description: This study progresses solar flare prediction research by presenting a full-disk deep-learning model to forecast $\geq$M-class solar flares and evaluating its efficacy on both central (within $\pm$70$^\circ$) and near-limb (beyond $\pm$70$^\circ$) events, showcasing qualitative assessment of post hoc explanations for the model's predictions, and providing empirical findings from human-centered quantitative assessments of these explanations.

item.title: Adaptive Multi-Modalities Fusion in Sequential Recommendation Systems
item.description: We propose a graph-based approach (named MMSR) to fuse modality features in an adaptive order, enabling each modality to prioritize either its inherent sequential nature or its interplay with other modalities.

item.title: Exploring Model Transferability through the Lens of Potential Energy
item.description: The experimental results on 10 downstream tasks and 12 self-supervised models demonstrate that our approach can seamlessly integrate into existing ranking techniques and enhance their performances, revealing its effectiveness for the model selection task and its potential for understanding the mechanism in transfer learning.

item.title: ADFA: Attention-augmented Differentiable top-k Feature Adaptation for Unsupervised Medical Anomaly Detection
item.description: We then apply differentiable top-k feature adaptation to train the patch descriptor, mapping the extracted feature representations to a new vector space, enabling effective detection of anomalies.

item.title: Detect, Augment, Compose, and Adapt: Four Steps for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation in Object Detection
item.description: Unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) plays a crucial role in object detection when adapting a source-trained detector to a target domain without annotated data.

item.title: OEBench: Investigating Open Environment Challenges in Real-World Relational Data Streams
item.description: Moreover, while several real-world streaming datasets are available, it is uncertain whether these open environment challenges are prevalent and how existing incremental learning algorithms perform on real datasets.

item.title: unORANIC: Unsupervised Orthogonalization of Anatomy and Image-Characteristic Features
item.description: We introduce unORANIC, an unsupervised approach that uses an adapted loss function to drive the orthogonalization of anatomy and image-characteristic features.

item.title: Measurement Tampering Detection Benchmark
item.description: When training powerful AI systems to perform complex tasks, it may be challenging to provide training signals which are robust to optimization.

item.title: MSFlow: Multi-Scale Flow-based Framework for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: Unsupervised anomaly detection (UAD) attracts a lot of research interest and drives widespread applications, where only anomaly-free samples are available for training.

item.title: AnomalyGPT: Detecting Industrial Anomalies using Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) such as MiniGPT-4 and LLaVA have demonstrated the capability of understanding images and achieved remarkable performance in various visual tasks.

item.title: Vision Grid Transformer for Document Layout Analysis
item.description: Document pre-trained models and grid-based models have proven to be very effective on various tasks in Document AI.

item.title: Spatio-temporal MLP-graph network for 3D human pose estimation
item.description: Graph convolutional networks and their variants have shown significant promise in 3D human pose estimation.

item.title: CLIPTrans: Transferring Visual Knowledge with Pre-trained Models for Multimodal Machine Translation
item.description: Simultaneously, there has been an influx of multilingual pre-trained models for NMT and multimodal pre-trained models for vision-language tasks, primarily in English, which have shown exceptional generalisation ability.

item.title: Glocal Explanations of Expected Goal Models in Soccer
item.description: This paper introduces the glocal explanations (between local and global levels) of the expected goal models to enable performance analysis at the team and player levels by proposing the use of aggregated versions of the SHAP values and partial dependence profiles.

item.title: On the Robustness of Object Detection Models in Aerial Images
item.description: The robustness of object detection models is a major concern when applied to real-world scenarios.

item.title: Probabilistic solar flare forecasting using historical magnetogram data
item.description: In this paper, we consider over 4 solar cycles of daily historical magnetogram data from multiple instruments.

item.title: Towards quantitative precision for ECG analysis: Leveraging state space models, self-supervision and patient metadata
item.description: These components consistently enhance performance beyond the existing state-of-the-art, which is predominantly based on convolutional models.

item.title: Evaluating Explanation Methods for Multivariate Time Series Classification
item.description: In many applications classification alone is not enough, we often need to classify but also understand what the model learns (e. g., why was a prediction given, based on what information in the data).

item.title: Where Would I Go Next? Large Language Models as Human Mobility Predictors
item.description: We posit that our research marks a significant paradigm shift in human mobility modelling, transitioning from building complex domain-specific models to harnessing general-purpose LLMs that yield accurate predictions through language instructions.

item.title: A Hybrid Membership Latent Distance Model for Unsigned and Signed Integer Weighted Networks
item.description: Graph representation learning (GRL) has become a prominent tool for furthering the understanding of complex networks providing tools for network embedding, link prediction, and node classification.

item.title: Enhancing Mobile Face Anti-Spoofing: A Robust Framework for Diverse Attack Types under Screen Flash
item.description: In this paper, we propose an attack type robust face anti-spoofing framework under light flash, called ATR-FAS.

item.title: Learning Modulated Transformation in GANs
item.description: The success of style-based generators largely benefits from style modulation, which helps take care of the cross-instance variation within data.

item.title: Enhancing Robot Learning through Learned Human-Attention Feature Maps
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach to model and emulate the human attention with an approximate prediction model.

item.title: Ensemble of Counterfactual Explainers
item.description: In eXplainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI), several counterfactual explainers have been proposed, each focusing on some desirable properties of counterfactual instances: minimality, actionability, stability, diversity, plausibility, discriminative power.

item.title: Bayesian Integration of Information Using Top-Down Modulated WTA Networks
item.description: The results show that WTA circuits are capable of integrating the probabilistic information represented by other WTA networks, and that top down processes can improve a WTA network's inference and learning performance.
